category: Gyeonggi Person Registration Regulations/Article 19 (Relationship with school system)
contents: Article 19 (Relationship with school system) ① If an athlete belonging to a school athletics department or a sports club within a school falls under any of the following items and the age and school system according to the registration classification in Article 18 (1) are different, the age You can register according to the academic standards of your school and engage in activities. However, in this case, the age difference between registration and activity cannot exceed one year. Revised 2022. 1. 24., 2023. 2. 10. 1. In case of repeating or repeating a grade due to family poverty (submit a certificate of National Basic Livelihood Recipient) 2. Member category by repeating a grade after receiving treatment for more than 6 months due to injury or illness 3. Cases where a medical certificate determined by the organization has been submitted 3. Cases where a grade has been repeated due to insufficient class days due to hospitalization 4. Cases where a school life record has been submitted as a person who postponed admission or entered school early Revised 2023. 2. 10. 5. Damaged by school violence, etc. In the case of repeating a grade after receiving a grade (submission of supporting materials proving the facts, such as a result notification from the School Violence Countermeasures Deliberation Committee or the School Violence Countermeasures Autonomous Committee) 6. Due to unavoidable reasons, it is recognized that the age and school system are different, and the member sport organization In case of decision on relief: Revised February 10, 2023 ② Registration of students scheduled to graduate from elementary, middle, high school, or university for advancement to higher schools or employment is limited to after graduation or dropping out of the final year of the relevant school level. However, if you submit a certificate of expected graduation and transfer consent form when registering for employment, you are considered to have graduated.
